SENT.plain: A mother affected with Apert's syndrome was diagnosed by ultrasound scan at 16-17 weeks to have a fetus similarly affected
The typical features of acrocephaly and symmetrical syndactyly were seen
This is probably the first time that this condition has been diagnosed at such a gestation by ultrasound scan
The patient decided to continue the pregnancy, and intrauterine death occurred at 34 weeks
The diagnosis was confirmed by pathological examination
